intro: Cardenasia setacea, commonly known as the hairy cardenasia, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is characterized by its unique, hairy leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is adapted to the arid conditions of its native habitat. Its structure includes a short, woody stem with alternate, ovate leaves. Cardenasia setacea is typically found in rocky or coastal areas, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
